title: The moments of split greatest common divisors
authors: Abhishek Jha, Ayan Nath, Emanuele Tron
abstract:
Sequences of the form $(\gcd(u_n,v_n))_{n \in \mathbb N}$, with $(u_n)_n$,
$(v_n)_n$ sums of $S$-units, have been considered by several authors. The study
of $\gcd(n,u_n)$ corresponds, following Silverman, to divisibility sequences
arising from the split algebraic group $\mathbb G_{\mathrm{a}} \times \mathbb
G_{\mathrm{m}}$; in this case, Sanna determined all asymptotic moments of the
arithmetic function $\log\,\gcd (n,u_n)$ when $(u_n)_n$ is a Lucas sequence.
Here, we characterize the asymptotic behavior of the moments themselves
$\sum_{n \leq x}\,\gcd(n,u_n)^\lambda$, thus solving the moment problem for
$\mathbb G_{\mathrm{a}} \times \mathbb G_{\mathrm{m}}$. We give both
unconditional and conditional results, the latter only relying on standard
conjectures in analytic number theory.
